column4: _tobias-> which one are you trying to access ? from the installed ubuntu by itself or the one with via wubi?
_tobias-> which one are you booted to now?
I'm trying to access the old one, the one which I didnt install ubuntu on
I installed ubuntu on the master-hdd, and I'm trying to access the slave one, via ubuntu, the slave one was just a backup-drive
any filesystem you wanted to view within ubuntu must be mounted, therefore mount the backup-drive
how to?
will this affect the filesystem in any way?
oh, ok :P, thanks for the help :)
mount: you must specify the filesystem type
mount: only root can do that
oh, yeh, right :P sorry
I mounted it, and it went away from the "places"-menu, It was there before I tried to mount it, "250 gb Media Disk"
mounting a ntfs-drive in ubuntu
so did you do   a    sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sdxx  /mnt   where /dev/sdxx is your ntfs partition?
yep
as nothing at all, and tried to do it again and I get "Device or resource is busy"
oh, there it is, but is it able to access it as a normal drive outside the terminal?
I get the whole disk with all folders printed in the terminal, and I want to access it with nautilus
perhaps you need a tutorial on how to use ubuntu..let me see if i can locate one,
Would love that :)
Thanks :)
